pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:0.4.eng: 6. The training rule on building huts

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āḷavakā bhikkhū saññācikāyo kuṭiyo kārāpenti assāmikāyo attuddesikāyo appamāṇikāyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.2.eng: At that time the monks of Āḷavī were building huts by means of begging. The huts were intended for themselves, did not have a sponsoring owner, and were inappropriately large.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.3.eng: And since they were never finished,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.4.eng: the monks kept on begging and asking,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.5.pli: “purisaṃ detha, purisatthakaraṃ detha, goṇaṃ detha, sakaṭaṃ detha, vāsiṃ detha, parasuṃ detha, kuṭhāriṃ detha, kudālaṃ detha, nikhādanaṃ detha, valliṃ detha, veḷuṃ detha, muñjaṃ detha, pabbajaṃ detha, tiṇaṃ detha, mattikaṃ dethā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.5.eng: “Please give a man, a servant, an ox, a cart, a machete, a hatchet, an ax, a spade, a chisel; give creepers, bamboo, reeds, grass, clay.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.5.comm: I have rendered muñja-reed and pabbaja-reed with the single word “reed”. I am not aware that these two kinds of reed can be distinguished in English.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.6.pli: Manussā upaddutā yācanāya upaddutā viññattiyā bhikkhū disvā ubbijjantipi uttasantipi palāyantipi aññenapi gacchanti aññenapi mukhaṃ karonti dvārampi thakenti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.6.eng: People felt oppressed by all the begging and asking, so much so that when they saw a monk they became alarmed and fearful. They turned away, took a different path, ran off, and closed their doors.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.7.eng: They even ran away when they saw cows, thinking they were monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.8.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo rājagahe vassaṃvuṭṭho yena āḷavī tena pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.8.eng: Just then Venerable Mahākassapa, after completing the rainy-season residence at Rājagaha, set out for Āḷavī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.10.pli: Tatra sudaṃ āyasmā mahākassapo āḷaviyaṃ viharati aggāḷave cetiye.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.10.eng: he stayed at the Aggāḷava Shrine.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.11.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya āḷaviṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.11.eng: One morning he robed up, took his bowl and robe, and entered Āḷavī for alms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.12.pli: Manussā āyasmantaṃ mahākassapaṃ passitvā ubbijjantipi uttasantipi palāyantipi aññenapi gacchanti aññenapi mukhaṃ karonti dvārampi thakenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.12.eng: When people saw him, they became alarmed and fearful. They turned away, took a different path, ran off, and closed their doors.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.13.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo āḷaviyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.13.eng: Then, when Venerable Mahākassapa had eaten his meal and returned from almsround, he said to the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.14.pli: “pubbāyaṃ, āvuso, āḷavī subhikkhā ahosi sulabhapiṇḍā sukarā uñchena paggahena yāpetuṃ;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.14.eng: “There used to be plenty of almsfood in Āḷavī, and it was easy to get by on alms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.15.pli: etarahi panāyaṃ āḷavī dubbhikkhā dullabhapiṇḍā, na sukarā uñchena paggahena yāpetuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.15.eng: But now there’s a shortage, and it’s hard to get by.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.16.pli: Ko nu kho, āvuso, hetu ko paccayo, yenāyaṃ āḷavī dubbhikkhā dullabhapiṇḍā, na sukarā uñchena paggahena yāpetun”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.17.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmato mahākassapassa etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.1.17.eng: The monks told Venerable Mahākassapa what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rājagahe yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena āḷavī tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha too set out wandering toward Āḷavī after staying at Rājagaha for as long as he liked.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena āḷavī tadavasari.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā āḷaviyaṃ viharati aggāḷave cetiye.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.3.eng: he too stayed at the Aggāḷava Shrine.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.4.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.4.eng: Venerable Mahākassapa then went to see the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.5.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā mahākassapo bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.5.eng: and told him what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā āḷavake bhikkhū paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.6.eng: The Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks of Āḷavī:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.7.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, saññācikāyo kuṭiyo kārāpetha assāmikāyo attuddesikāyo appamāṇikāyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.7.eng: “Is it true, monks, that this is happening?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.10.pli: ‘purisaṃ detha purisatthakaraṃ detha …pe… tiṇaṃ detha mattikaṃ dethā’ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.11.pli: Manussā upaddutā yācanāya upaddutā viññattiyā bhikkhū disvā ubbijjantipi uttasantipi palāyantipi aññenapi gacchanti aññenapi mukhaṃ karonti dvārampi thakenti, gāvimpi disvā palāyanti bhikkhūti maññamānā”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.14.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, saṃyācikāyo kuṭiyo kārāpessatha assāmikāyo attuddesikāyo appamāṇikāyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.14.eng: “Foolish men, how can you act like this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.17.pli: “purisaṃ detha purisatthakaraṃ detha …pe… tiṇaṃ detha mattikaṃ dethā”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.19.pli: vigarahitvā dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.2.19.eng: After rebuking them, he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.0.comm: This story is parallel to the Maṇikaṇṭhajātaka, story number 253 in the Jātaka collection.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.1.pli: “Bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, dve bhātaro isayo gaṅgaṃ nadiṃ upanissāya vihariṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.1.eng: “Once upon a time, monks, two sages who were brothers lived near the river Ganges.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.2.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, maṇikaṇṭho nāgarājā gaṅgaṃ nadiṃ uttaritvā yena kaniṭṭho isi tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā kaniṭṭhaṃ isiṃ sattakkhattuṃ bhogehi parikkhipitvā uparimuddhani mahantaṃ phaṇaṃ karitvā aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.2.eng: On one occasion the dragon king Maṇikaṇṭha emerged from the Ganges and went up to the younger sage. He encircled him with seven coils and spread his large hood over his head.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.3.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, kaniṭṭho isi tassa nāgassa bhayā kiso ahosi lūkho dubbaṇṇo uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajāto dhamanisanthatagatto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.3.eng: Then, because of his fear of that dragon, the younger sage became thin, haggard, and pale, with veins protruding all over his body.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.4.pli: Addasa kho, bhikkhave, jeṭṭho isi kaniṭṭhaṃ isiṃ kisaṃ lūkhaṃ dubbaṇṇaṃ uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajātaṃ dhamanisanthatagattaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.4.eng: The older sage saw him like this

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.5.eng: and asked him what was the matter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.6.pli: ‘kissa tvaṃ, bho, kiso lūkho dubbaṇṇo uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajāto dhamanisanthatagatto’ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.7.pli: ‘Idha, bho, maṇikaṇṭho nāgarājā gaṅgaṃ nadiṃ uttaritvā yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā maṃ sattakkhattuṃ bhogehi parikkhipitvā uparimuddhani mahantaṃ phaṇaṃ karitvā aṭṭhāsi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.8.pli: Tassāhaṃ, bho, nāgassa bhayā kiso lūkho dubbaṇṇo uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajāto dhamanisanthatagatto’ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.9.pli: ‘Icchasi pana tvaṃ, bho, tassa nāgassa anāgamanan’ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.9.eng: The elder sage said, ‘So, do you want that dragon to stay away?’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.11.pli: ‘Api pana tvaṃ, bho, tassa nāgassa kiñci passasī’ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.11.eng: ‘Well then, did you see anything belonging to that dragon?’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.12.eng: ‘I saw an ornamental gem on his neck.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.13.pli: ‘Tena hi tvaṃ, bho, taṃ nāgaṃ maṇiṃ yāca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.13.eng: ‘In that case, ask the dragon for that gem.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.16.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, maṇikaṇṭho nāgarājā gaṅgaṃ nadiṃ uttaritvā yena kaniṭṭho isi tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.16.eng: Soon the dragon king again emerged from the Ganges and went up to the younger sage.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.17.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhitaṃ kho, bhikkhave, maṇikaṇṭhaṃ nāgarājānaṃ kaniṭṭho isi etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.17.eng: And the sage said to him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.21.pli: ‘bhikkhu maṇiṃ yācati, bhikkhussa maṇinā attho’ti khippaññeva agamāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.21.eng: ‘The monk is asking for the gem; he wants the gem,’ and he left in a hurry.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.22.pli: Dutiyampi kho, bhikkhave, maṇikaṇṭho nāgarājā gaṅgaṃ nadiṃ uttaritvā yena kaniṭṭho isi tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.22.eng: Once more the dragon king emerged from the Ganges and approached the younger sage.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.23.pli: Addasa kho, bhikkhave, kaniṭṭho isi maṇikaṇṭhaṃ nāgarājānaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.28.pli: ‘bhikkhu maṇiṃ yācati, bhikkhussa maṇinā attho’ti tatova paṭinivatti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.29.pli: Tatiyampi kho, bhikkhave, maṇikaṇṭho nāgarājā gaṅgaṃ nadiṃ uttarati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.29.eng: Yet again the dragon king emerged from the Ganges.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.30.pli: Addasa kho, bhikkhave, kaniṭṭho isi maṇikaṇṭhaṃ nāgarājānaṃ gaṅgaṃ nadiṃ uttarantaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.30.eng: The younger sage saw him emerging

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.34.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, maṇikaṇṭho nāgarājā kaniṭṭhaṃ isiṃ gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.34.eng: The dragon king then spoke these verses to the sage:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.35.eng: ‘My food and drink are abundant and sublime,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.36.eng: And they appear because of this gem.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.37.eng: I won’t give it to you—you ask too much—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.38.eng: Nor will I return to your hermitage.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.39.eng: Like a youth holding a sword polished on a rock,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.39.comm: Sp 1.344: Sakkharā vuccati kāḷasilā, tattha dhoto asi “sakkharadhoto nāmā”ti vuccati, sakkharadhoto pāṇimhi assāti sakkharadhotapāṇi, pāsāṇe dhotanisitakhaggahatthoti attho; “A black rock is what is meant by sakkharā. A sword polished on that is termed sakkharadhota. A sword in his hand polished on a rock is the meaning of sakkharadhotapāṇi. The meaning is a hand with a sword that is sharp and polished on a rock.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.40.eng: You frighten me, asking for this gem.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.40.comm: Sp 1.344: Yathā so asihattho puriso tāseyya, evaṁ tāsesi maṁ selaṁ yācamāno, maṇiṁ yācantoti attho, “The meaning is that just as that man with sword in hand would cause fear, so the one asking me for the rock, asking for the gem, caused fear.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.41.eng: I won’t give it to you—you ask too much—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.42.eng: Nor will I return to your hermitage.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.43.eng: And the dragon king Maṇikaṇṭha thought,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.44.pli: ‘bhikkhu maṇiṃ yācati, bhikkhussa maṇinā attho’ti pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.44.eng: ‘The monk is asking for the gem; he wants the gem,’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.45.pli: Tathā pakkantova ahosi, na puna paccāgañchi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.45.eng: and he left and never returned.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.46.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, kaniṭṭho isi tassa nāgassa dassanīyassa adassanena bhiyyoso mattāya kiso ahosi lūkho dubbaṇṇo, uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajāto dhamanisanthatagatto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.46.eng: Because he did not get to see that beautiful dragon, the young sage became even thinner, more haggard and pale, his veins protruding even more.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.47.pli: Addasa kho, bhikkhave, jeṭṭho isi kaniṭṭhaṃ isiṃ bhiyyoso mattāya kisaṃ lūkhaṃ dubbaṇṇaṃ uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajātaṃ dhamanisanthatagattaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.47.eng: The older sage saw him like this

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.48.eng: and asked what was the matter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.49.pli: ‘kissa tvaṃ, bho, bhiyyoso mattāya kiso lūkho dubbaṇṇo uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajāto dhamanisanthatagatto’ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.50.pli: ‘Tassāhaṃ, bho, nāgassa dassanīyassa adassanena bhiyyoso mattāya kiso lūkho dubbaṇṇo uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajāto dhamanisanthatagatto’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.50.eng: He replied, ‘It’s because I no longer get to see that beautiful dragon.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.51.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, jeṭṭho isi kaniṭṭhaṃ isiṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.51.eng: The older sage then spoke to him in verse:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.52.eng: ‘One shouldn’t beg from those one wishes to be dear to;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.53.eng: One is detested for asking for too much.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.54.eng: When the brahmin asked the dragon for his gem,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.55.eng: It left and was never to be seen again.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.56.pli: Tesañhi nāma, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatānaṃ pāṇānaṃ amanāpā bhavissati yācanā amanāpā viññatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.3.56.eng: One will be disliked even by animals, monks, for begging and asking,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.0.comm: This story seems to be unique to this rule.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.1.pli: Bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, aññataro bhikkhu himavantapasse viharati aññatarasmiṃ vanasaṇḍe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.1.eng: “At one time, monks, a certain monk lived in a forest grove on the slopes of the Himalayas.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.2.pli: Tassa kho, bhikkhave, vanasaṇḍassa avidūre mahantaṃ ninnaṃ pallalaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.2.eng: Not far from that grove was a large, low-lying marsh.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.3.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, mahāsakuṇasaṅgho tasmiṃ pallale divasaṃ gocaraṃ caritvā sāyaṃ taṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ vāsāya upagacchati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.3.eng: A great flock of birds fed in the marsh during the day and entered the grove to roost at night.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.4.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, so bhikkhu tassa sakuṇasaṅghassa saddena ubbāḷho yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā maṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.4.eng: The monk was disturbed by the noise of the flocking birds, and so he came to see me. He bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.5.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.6.eng: ‘I hope you’re keeping well, monk, I hope you’re getting by?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.7.eng: I hope you’re not tired from traveling?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.8.eng: And where have you come from?’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.9.eng: ‘I’m keeping well, sir, I’m getting by.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.11.eng: He then explained where he had come from, adding,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.12.pli: Tassa kho pana, bhante, vanasaṇḍassa avidūre mahantaṃ ninnaṃ pallalaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.13.pli: Atha kho, bhante, mahāsakuṇasaṅgho tasmiṃ pallale divasaṃ gocaraṃ caritvā sāyaṃ taṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ vāsāya upagacchati.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.15.eng: I left because I was disturbed by the noise of that flock of birds.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.16.pli: ‘Icchasi pana tvaṃ, bhikkhu, tassa sakuṇasaṅghassa anāgamanan’ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.16.eng: ‘Do you want that flock of birds to stay away?’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.18.pli: ‘Tena hi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, tattha gantvā taṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ ajjhogāhetvā rattiyā paṭhamaṃ yāmaṃ tikkhattuṃ saddamanussāvehi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.18.eng: ‘Well then, go back to that forest grove. In the first part of the night, call out three times and say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.20.pli: yāvatikā imasmiṃ vanasaṇḍe vāsaṃ upagatā, pattena me attho.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.20.eng: I want a feather from anyone roosting in this forest grove.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.21.eng: Each one of you must give me a feather.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.23.eng: and last part of the night do the same thing.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.25.pli: yāvatikā imasmiṃ vanasaṇḍe vāsaṃ upagatā, pattena me attho.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.27.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, so bhikkhu tattha gantvā taṃ vanasaṇḍaṃ ajjhogāhetvā rattiyā paṭhamaṃ yāmaṃ tikkhattuṃ saddamanussāvesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.27.eng: The monk returned to that forest grove and did as instructed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.29.pli: yāvatikā imasmiṃ vanasaṇḍe vāsaṃ upagatā, pattena me attho.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.34.pli: yāvatikā imasmiṃ vanasaṇḍe vāsaṃ upagatā, pattena me attho.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.37.eng: ‘The monk is asking for a feather; he wants a feather,’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.39.pli: Tathā pakkantova ahosi na puna paccāgañchi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.40.pli: Tesañhi nāma, bhikkhave, tiracchānagatānaṃ pāṇānaṃ amanāpā bhavissati yācanā amanāpā viññatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.4.40.eng: One will be disliked even by animals, monks, for begging and asking,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.5.1.pli: Bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, raṭṭhapālassa kulaputtassa pitā raṭṭhapālaṃ kulaputtaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.5.1.eng: “Raṭṭhapāla’s father, monks, once spoke to his son with this verse:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.5.1.comm: For the inspiring story of Raṭṭhapāla, see MN 82:1.1.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.5.3.eng: Who come to me and beg—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.5.5.eng: So why don’t you beg from me?’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.5.7.eng: And so is one who doesn’t give when asked.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.5.8.eng: That’s why I do not beg from you;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.5.9.eng: Please don’t hate me for this.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.5.10.pli: So hi nāma, bhikkhave, raṭṭhapālo kulaputto sakaṃ pitaraṃ evaṃ vakkhati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.5.10.eng: If the gentleman Raṭṭhapāla could say this to his own father,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.5.11.eng: how much more can one person to another.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.6.1.pli: Gihīnaṃ, bhikkhave, dussaṃharāni bhogāni sambhatānipi durakkhiyāni.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.6.1.eng: It’s hard, monks, for householders to acquire and protect their possessions.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.6.2.pli: Tattha nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, evaṃ dussaṃharesu bhogesu sambhatesupi durakkhiyesu yācanabahulā viññattibahulā viharissatha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.6.2.eng: And still, foolish men, you kept on begging and asking

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.6.3.pli: ‘purisaṃ detha, purisatthakaraṃ detha, goṇaṃ detha, sakaṭaṃ detha, vāsiṃ detha, parasuṃ detha, kuṭhāriṃ detha, kudālaṃ detha, nikhādanaṃ detha, valliṃ detha, veḷuṃ detha, muñjaṃ detha, pabbajaṃ detha, tiṇaṃ detha, mattikaṃ dethā’ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.6.5.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.6.5.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.6.6.1.pli: “Saññācikāya pana bhikkhunā kuṭiṃ kārayamānena assāmikaṃ attuddesaṃ pamāṇikā kāretabbā. Tatridaṃ pamāṇaṃ—dīghaso dvādasa vidatthiyo, sugatavidatthiyā; tiriyaṃ sattantarā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.6.6.1.eng: ‘When a monk, by means of begging, builds a hut without a sponsoring owner and intended for himself, it is to be no more than twelve standard handspans long and seven wide inside.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.6.7.pli: Bhikkhū abhinetabbā vatthudesanāya. Tehi bhikkhūhi vatthu desetabbaṃ— anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.6.7.eng: He must have monks approve a site where no harm will be done and which has space on all sides.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.6.8.pli: Sārambhe ce bhikkhu vatthusmiṃ aparikkamane saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kāreyya, bhikkhū vā anabhineyya vatthudesanāya, pamāṇaṃ vā atikkāmeyya, saṅghādiseso”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:1.6.8.eng: If a monk, by means of begging, builds a hut on a site where harm will be done and which lacks space on all sides, or he does not have monks approve the site, or he exceeds the right size, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.1.2.pli: sayaṃ yācitvā purisampi purisatthakarampi goṇampi sakaṭampi vāsimpi parasumpi kuṭhārimpi kudālampi nikhādanampi vallimpi veḷumpi muñjampi pabbajampi tiṇampi mattikampi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.1.2.eng: having himself begged for a man, a servant, an ox, a cart, a machete, a hatchet, an ax, a spade, a chisel; creepers, bamboo, reed, grass, clay.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.1.4.pli: ullittā vā hoti avalittā vā ullittāvalittā vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.1.4.eng: plastered inside or plastered outside or plastered both inside and outside.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.1.6.eng: building it himself or having it built.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.1.8.pli: na añño koci sāmiko hoti, itthī vā puriso vā gahaṭṭho vā pabbajito vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.1.8.eng: there is no other owner, either a woman or a man, either a lay person or one gone forth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.1.11.comm: In the rule formulation above, I have not translated the phrase pamāṇikā kāretabbā. This is for stylistic reasons. It is often awkward in English to replicate the exact phrasing of the Pali. This means that the same phrase is also not translated here in the word commentary.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.1.12.eng: It is to be no more than twelve standard handspans long:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.1.12.comm: “Standard” renders sugata. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.1.eng: He must have monks approve a site:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.2.pli: tena kuṭikārakena bhikkhunā kuṭivatthuṃ sodhetvā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.2.eng: the monk who wants to build a hut should clear a site. He should then approach the Sangha, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.3.pli: “ahaṃ, bhante, saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kattukāmo assāmikaṃ attuddesaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.3.eng: “Venerables, I want to build a hut by means of begging, without a sponsoring owner and intended for myself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.4.eng: I request the Sangha to inspect the site for that hut.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.5.eng: He should make his request a second

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.7.pli: Sace sabbo saṅgho ussahati kuṭivatthuṃ oloketuṃ, sabbena saṅghena oloketabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.7.eng: If the whole Sangha is able to inspect the site, they should all go.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.8.pli: No ce sabbo saṅgho ussahati kuṭivatthuṃ oloketuṃ, ye tattha honti bhikkhū byattā paṭibalā sārambhaṃ anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ aparikkamanaṃ jānituṃ te yācitvā sammannitabbā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.8.eng: If the whole Sangha is unable to inspect the site, then those monks there who are competent and capable—who know where harm will be done and where no harm will be done, who know what is meant by space on all sides and a lack of space on all sides—should be asked and then appointed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.9.eng: “And, monks, they should be appointed like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.10.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.11.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.12.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kattukāmo assāmikaṃ attuddesaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.12.eng: Monk so-and-so wants to build a hut by means of begging, without a sponsoring owner and intended for himself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.13.eng: He is requesting the Sangha to inspect the site for that hut.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.14.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmañca itthannāmañca bhikkhū sammanneyya itthannāmassa bhikkhuno kuṭivatthuṃ oloketuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.14.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should appoint monk so-and-so and monk so-and-so to inspect the site for the hut of monk so-and-so.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.16.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.17.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kattukāmo assāmikaṃ attuddesaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.17.eng: Monk so-and-so wants to build a hut by means of begging, without a sponsoring owner and intended for himself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.18.eng: He is requesting the Sangha to inspect the site for that hut.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.19.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmañca itthannāmañca bhikkhū sammannati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno kuṭivatthuṃ oloketuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.19.eng: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so and monk so-and-so to inspect the site for the hut of monk so-and-so.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.20.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa ca itthannāmassa ca bhikkhūnaṃ sammuti itthannāmassa bhikkhuno kuṭivatthuṃ oloketuṃ, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.20.eng: Any monk who approves of appointing monk so-and-so and monk so-and-so to inspect the site for the hut of monk so-and-so should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.21.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.22.pli: Sammatā saṅghena itthannāmo ca itthannāmo ca bhikkhū itthannāmassa bhikkhuno kuṭivatthuṃ oloketuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.22.eng: The Sangha has appointed monk so-and-so and monk so-and-so to inspect the site for the hut of monk so-and-so.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.23.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.25.pli: Tehi sammatehi bhikkhūhi tattha gantvā kuṭivatthu oloketabbaṃ, sārambhaṃ anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ aparikkamanaṃ jānitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.25.eng: The appointed monks should go and inspect the site for the hut to find out if any harm will be done and if it has space on all sides.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.26.pli: Sace sārambhaṃ hoti aparikkamanaṃ, “mā idha karī”ti vattabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.26.eng: If harm will be done or it lacks space on all sides, they should say, ‘Don’t build here.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.27.pli: Sace anārambhaṃ hoti saparikkamanaṃ, saṅghassa ārocetabbaṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.27.eng: If no harm will be done and it has space on all sides, they should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.28.eng: ‘No harm will be done and it has space on all sides.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.29.pli: Tena kuṭikārakena bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.29.eng: The monk who wants to build the hut should then approach the Sangha, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.30.pli: “ahaṃ, bhante, saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kattukāmo assāmikaṃ attuddesaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.30.eng: ‘Venerables, I want to build a hut by means of begging, without a sponsoring owner and intended for myself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.31.eng: I request the Sangha to approve the site for the hut.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.32.eng: He should make his request a second

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.34.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.35.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.36.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kattukāmo assāmikaṃ attuddesaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.36.eng: Monk so-and-so wants to build a hut by means of begging, without a sponsoring owner and intended for himself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.37.eng: He is requesting the Sangha to approve the site for that hut.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.38.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno kuṭivatthuṃ deseyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.38.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should approve the site for the hut of monk-so-and-so.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.40.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.41.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kattukāmo assāmikaṃ attuddesaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.41.eng: Monk so-and-so wants to build a hut by means of begging, without a sponsoring owner and intended for himself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.42.eng: He is requesting the Sangha to approve the site for that hut.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.43.eng: The Sangha approves the site for the hut of monk so-and-so.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.44.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno kuṭivatthussa desanā, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.44.eng: Any monk who agrees to approving the site for the hut of monk-so-and-so should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.45.eng: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.46.eng: The Sangha has approved the site for the hut of monk so-and-so.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.2.47.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.3.2.pli: kipillikānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, upacikānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, undūrānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, ahīnaṃ vā āsayo hoti, vicchikānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, satapadīnaṃ vā āsayo hoti, hatthīnaṃ vā āsayo hoti, assānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, sīhānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, byagghānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, dīpīnaṃ vā āsayo hoti, acchānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, taracchānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, yesaṃ kesañci tiracchānagatānaṃ pāṇānaṃ āsayo hoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.3.2.eng: it is the abode of ants, termites, rats, snakes, scorpions, centipedes, elephants, horses, lions, tigers, leopards, bears, or hyenas, or any other animal;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.3.3.pli: pubbaṇṇanissitaṃ vā hoti, aparaṇṇanissitaṃ vā hoti, abbhāghātanissitaṃ vā hoti, āghātananissitaṃ vā hoti, susānanissitaṃ vā hoti, uyyānanissitaṃ vā hoti, rājavatthunissitaṃ vā hoti, hatthisālānissitaṃ vā hoti, assasālānissitaṃ vā hoti, bandhanāgāranissitaṃ vā hoti, pānāgāranissitaṃ vā hoti, sūnanissitaṃ vā hoti, racchānissitaṃ vā hoti, caccaranissitaṃ vā hoti, sabhānissitaṃ vā hoti, saṃsaraṇanissitaṃ vā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.3.3.eng: or it is bordering on a field of grain, a field of vegetables, a place of slaughter, a place of execution, a charnel ground, a park, a royal property, an elephant stable, a horse stable, a prison, a bar, a slaughterhouse, a street, a crossroads, a public meeting hall, or a cul-de-sac—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.3.3.comm: “Elephant stable” renders hatthisālā. For the meaning of sālā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.3.4.eng: this is called “where harm will be done”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.3.5.eng: Which lacks space on all sides:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.3.6.pli: na sakkā hoti yathāyuttena sakaṭena anuparigantuṃ samantā nisseṇiyā anuparigantuṃ. Etaṃ aparikkamanaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.3.6.eng: it is not possible to go around it with a yoked cart, or to go all the way around it with a ladder—this is called “which lacks space on all sides”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.3.7.eng: Where no harm will be done:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.3.8.pli: na kipillikānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, na upacikānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, na undūrānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, na ahīnaṃ vā āsayo hoti, na vicchikānaṃ vā āsayo hoti, na satapadīnaṃ vā āsayo hoti …pe… na saṃsaraṇanissitaṃ vā hoti. Etaṃ anārambhaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.3.8.eng: it is not the abode of ants, termites, rats, snakes, scorpions, centipedes … it is not bordering on … a cul-de-sac—this is called “where no harm will be done”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.3.9.eng: Which has space on all sides:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.3.10.pli: sakkā hoti yathāyuttena sakaṭena anuparigantuṃ, samantā nisseṇiyā anuparigantuṃ. Etaṃ saparikkamanaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.3.10.eng: it is possible to go around it with a yoked cart, or to go all the way around it with a ladder—this is called “which has space on all sides”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.4.2.eng: having himself begged for a man, a servant … clay.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.4.4.pli: ullittā vā hoti avalittā vā ullittāvalittā vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.4.4.eng: plastered inside or plastered outside or plastered both inside and outside.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.4.6.eng: building it himself or having it built.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.4.7.pli: Bhikkhū vā anabhineyya, vatthudesanāya pamāṇaṃ vā atikkāmeyyāti
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.4.7.eng: Or he does not have monks approve the site, or he exceeds the right size:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.4.8.pli: ñattidutiyena kammena kuṭivatthuṃ na desāpetvā, āyāmato vā vitthārato vā antamaso kesaggamattampi atikkāmetvā karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.4.8.eng: if the site for the hut has not been approved through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements, or if he builds a hut or has one built that exceeds the allowable length or breadth even by the width of a hair, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.4.9.eng: When there is one piece left to complete the hut, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.4.10.eng: When the last piece is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.4.11.eng: He commits an offense entailing suspension:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:2.4.12.eng: … Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.1.1.pli: Bhikkhu kuṭiṃ karoti adesitavatthukaṃ sārambhaṃ aparikkamanaṃ, āpatti saṅghādisesena dvinnaṃ dukkaṭānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.1.1.eng: If a monk builds a hut whose site has not been approved, where harm will be done, and which lacks space on all sides, he commits one offense entailing suspension and two offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.1.2.pli: Bhikkhu kuṭiṃ karoti adesitavatthukaṃ sārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ, āpatti saṅghādisesena dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.1.2.eng: If a monk builds a hut whose site has not been approved, where harm will be done, but which has space on all sides, he commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.1.3.pli: Bhikkhu kuṭiṃ karoti adesitavatthukaṃ anārambhaṃ aparikkamanaṃ, āpatti saṅghādisesena dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.1.3.eng: If a monk builds a hut whose site has not been approved, where no harm will be done, but which lacks space on all sides, he commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.1.4.pli: Bhikkhu kuṭiṃ karoti adesitavatthukaṃ anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.1.4.eng: If a monk builds a hut whose site has not been approved, where no harm will be done, and which has space on all sides, he commits one offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.1.5.pli: Bhikkhu kuṭiṃ karoti desitavatthukaṃ sārambhaṃ aparikkamanaṃ, āpatti dvinnaṃ dukkaṭānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.1.5.eng: If a monk builds a hut whose site has been approved, where harm will be done, and which lacks space on all sides, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.1.6.pli: Bhikkhu kuṭiṃ karoti desitavatthukaṃ sārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.1.6.eng: If a monk builds a hut whose site has been approved, where harm will be done, but which has space on all sides, he commits one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.1.7.pli: Bhikkhu kuṭiṃ karoti desitavatthukaṃ anārambhaṃ aparikkamanaṃ, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.1.7.eng: If a monk builds a hut whose site has been approved, where no harm will be done, but which lacks space on all sides, he commits one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.1.8.pli: Bhikkhu kuṭiṃ karoti desitavatthukaṃ anārambhaṃ saparikkamanaṃ, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.1.8.eng: If a monk builds a hut whose site has been approved, where no harm will be done, and which has space on all sides, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.2.1.pli: Bhikkhu kuṭiṃ karoti pamāṇātikkantaṃ sārambhaṃ aparikkamanaṃ, āpatti saṅghādisesena dvinnaṃ dukkaṭānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.2.1.eng: If a monk builds a hut which exceeds the right size, where harm will be done, and which lacks space on all sides, he commits one offense entailing suspension and two offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.9.0.eng: Departing and then hearing about wrong building procedure

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.9.1.eng: A monk appoints someone to build him a hut. He then departs,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.9.2.pli: Samādisati ca— “desitavatthukā ca hotu anārambhā ca saparikkamanā cā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.9.2.eng: telling them to build one whose site has been approved, where no harm will be done, and which has space on all sides,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.9.3.pli: Tassa kuṭiṃ karonti adesitavatthukaṃ sārambhaṃ aparikkamanaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.9.3.eng: but they build one whose site has not been approved, where harm will be done, and which lacks space on all sides.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.9.4.pli: So suṇāti—“kuṭi kira me kayirati adesitavatthukā sārambhā aparikkamanā”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.13.10.eng: where harm will be done, but which has space on all sides, the builders commit one offense of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.13.11.eng: where no harm will be done, but which lacks space on all sides, the builders commit one offense of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.13.12.eng: where no harm will be done, and which has space on all sides, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.13.14.pli: Samādisati ca— “desitavatthukā ca hotu pamāṇikā ca anārambhā ca saparikkamanā cā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.13.14.eng: telling them to build one whose site has been approved, which is the right size, where no harm will be done, and which has space on all sides.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.13.15.eng: If they build one whose site has not been approved, which exceeds the right size, where harm will be done, and which lacks space on all sides, the builders commit four offenses of wrong conduct. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.14.1.eng: A monk appoints someone to build him a hut and then departs.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.14.2.pli: Tassa kuṭiṃ karonti adesitavatthukaṃ sārambhaṃ aparikkamanaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.14.2.eng: They build one whose site has not been approved, where harm will be done, and which lacks space on all sides.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.14.3.pli: So ce vippakate āgacchati, tena bhikkhunā sā kuṭi aññassa vā dātabbā bhinditvā vā puna kātabbā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.14.3.eng: If it is unfinished when he returns, that hut is to be given to someone else, or it is to be demolished and rebuilt.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.14.4.pli: No ce aññassa vā dadeyya bhinditvā vā puna kāreyya, āpatti saṅghādisesena dvinnaṃ dukkaṭānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.14.4.eng: If he neither gives it to someone else, nor demolishes and rebuilds it, he commits one offense entailing suspension and two offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.15.1.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.15.1.eng: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.15.2.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.15.2.eng: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.15.3.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.15.3.eng: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.15.4.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.15.4.eng: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.16.3.comm: For the rendering of guhā as “cave”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.16.4.eng: if it is a grass hut;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.16.5.eng: if it is built for someone else;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.16.6.eng: if it is anything apart from a dwelling;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.16.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss6:3.16.9.eng: The training rule on building huts, the sixth, is finished.
